newsitem.title: JAPAN: US TREASURIES FIRM SLIGHTLY BUT EASY TONE LINGERS.
newsitem.headline: US TREASURIES FIRM SLIGHTLY BUT EASY TONE LINGERS.

text.p: U.S. Treasuries were slightly firmer by midday Tokyo on Thursday in thin trade after gaining overnight in reaction to July retail sales data, which came in close to market expectations, traders said.

But overall sentiment remains weak with the ascent in prices seen slow, they added. "U.S. Treasuries rose on short covering overnight after traders' fears of strong retail sales data were dispelled. But selling pressure on rises was very strong, while there was not much buying interest on dips," a trader at a Japanese bank said. "Sentiment is still weak based on the supply/demand relationship," he said.
